sn19.14:4.1: “Just now, Reverend, as I was descending from Vulture’s Peak Mountain I saw a stinking fishwife flying through the air.
sn19.14:4.2: Vultures, crows, and hawks kept chasing her, pecking, plucking, and hacking
sn19.14:4.4: “That woman used to be an fortune-teller right here in Rājagaha. …”
